remarks: Reverse closure law, in contrast to ~ ndmovrcl where it is required that the operation's domain doesn't contain the empty set ( ` -. (/) e. S ` ), no additional asumption is required.  (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 26-May-2017.)
statement:
ndmaov.1 $e |- dom F = ( S X. S ) $.
ndmaovrcl $p |- ( (( A F B )) e. S -> ( A e. S /\ B e. S ) ) $.
